title: Open Web with Edge Chromium require folder permissions
author: bitboy85
body_snippet:
Try open a webpage with default install and normal user. Set Engine to Edge Chromium.
The result is an empty page.

Give the user modify permission on the installation directory of mremoteNG and retry. It works.
An additional folder "mRemoteNG.exe.WebView2" is created within the install directory.

This is a bad design. Normal users should never require write permissions in program folders.

Affected: The current nightly, 1.77.3 1784

comments.snippet:
Hi

With issue #2256 a workaround with installing WebView2 for MS Edge (https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/webview2/) was documented which then remediates the need of changing the folder permissions, but I am with you that this is a design or documentation issue that needs to be addressed.

comments.snippet:
Hi,

WebView2 was installed and i still needed the folder permission. To check: Make sure Webview2 is installed and remove the folder "mRemoteNG.exe.WebView2" and also the permission -> websites won't open again.

Sadly i'm also affected with the self-signed certificate issue.

Here is how to fix: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/webview2/concepts/user-data-folder?tabs=dotnet
As path %APPDATA%\mRemoteNG\webview2 should work in most cases (roaming profile)
comments.author: bitboy85

comments.snippet:
Just add this reg key to force redirect folder to appdata\local.

reg add "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\WebView2\UserDataFolder" /v mRemoteNG.exe    /t REG_SZ    /d "C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\mRemoteNG\WebView2" /f

just change <user> on this command with your username.
comments.author: JustBeta

comments.snippet:
@JustBeta your command can be executed directly like this so theres no need to replace anything :) just use the `%username%` variable.

```
 reg add "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\WebView2\UserDataFolder" /v mRemoteNG.exe /t REG_SZ /d "C:\Users\%username%\AppData\Local\mRemoteNG\WebView2" /f
```

comments.snippet:
yes, the variable is ok, but is a choice.
this key is in the user hive, If you use the variable, change this key for the local machine
This impacts all your users with the modification.
